sources.title: Medal for the General
sources.description: “Touching story of the home front” “Solid comedy-drama” (IMDB  reviews quotes). Godfrey Tearle has the title role of an old warrior embittered by being refused a military post at the outbreak of WW2, who then is forced to take in five evacuee children from the London slums. Good supporting cast and adequate production values. Recommended. IMDB rating 7.0. Directed by Maurice Elvey. UK release 1944. US release 1946. Complete print ? A.K.A. “The Gay Intruders". CAST NOTE: The film debut of Petula Clark (age 9)

metadata.Plot: "A Medal for the General" is the story of an-over-the-hill WWI general (Godfrey Tearle) who is downcast when he is told he is too old for WWII and keeps himself isolated on his spacious estate. Six children from the slum area are evacuated and billeted in his home and their numerous problems give him a new interest in life. He is awarded a medal for his good work. Jeanne de Casalis is his devoted friend and Moreland Graham plays his faithful valet.
metadata.Actors: Godfrey Tearle, Jeanne De Casalis, Morland Graham
